snippet: John Kerry made his first trip to an Arab capital as secretary of state on Saturday, hoping to prod Egyptian politicians to show a measure of political peace and a commitment to economic change.
abstract: Secretary of State John Kerry tells Egypt’s political and business leaders that it is urgent their country institute economic reforms and satisfy conditions International Monetary Fund has set for $4.8 billion loan; Kerry's visit comes at a time of economic peril in Egypt.

byline.original: By MICHAEL R. GORDON and DAVID D. KIRKPATRICK
byline.contributor: Michael R. Gordon reported from Cairo, and David D. Kirkpatrick from Istanbul.

lead_paragraph: John Kerry made his first trip to an Arab capital as secretary of state on Saturday, hoping to prod Egyptian politicians to show a measure of political peace and a commitment to economic change.

headline.main: Kerry Is Hoping to Nudge Egypt Toward Reforms
headline.print_headline: Kerry Is Hoping to Nudge Egypt Toward Reforms

keywords.value: Middle East and North Africa Unrest (2010- )
